content.1: Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,
content.3: All therefore whatsoever they bid you observe,
content.4: For they bind heavy burdens and grievous to be borne, and lay
content.5: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries, and enlarge the borders of their garments,
content.6: And love the uppermost rooms at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,
content.7: And greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.
content.8: But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your Master,
content.10: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your Master,
content.11: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.
content.12: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.
content.14: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore ye shall receive the greater damnation.
content.15: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.
content.18: And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is guilty.
content.20: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.
content.21: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.
content.22: And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.
content.23: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay tithe of mint and anise and cummin, and have omitted the weightier
content.25: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.
content.27: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead
content.28: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
content.29: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,
content.30: And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.
content.31: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.
content.32: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.
content.35: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.
content.36: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.
content.38: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.
content.39: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed
